reg_info.full_title: O. Reg. 133/16: DEEMED SERVICE OF NOTICES

content.content: 1. (1) If service of a notice under section 17.5, 17.6 or 17.7 of the Act is made by email, the notice is deemed to have been served on the business day after the email was sent or on the day the notice was received, whichever is earlier. (2) If service of a notice under section 17.5, 17.6 or 17.7 of the Act is made by registered mail, the notice is deemed to have been served on the fifth business day after the day the mail was sent or on the day the notice was received, whichever is earlier. (3) In this section, “business day” means Monday to Friday, excluding holidays.
content.raw_html:
1. (1) If service of a notice under section 17.5, 17.6 or 17.7 of the Act is made by email, the notice is deemed to have been served on the business day after the email was sent or on the day the notice was received, whichever is earlier.

(2) If service of a notice under section 17.5, 17.6 or 17.7 of the Act is made by registered mail, the notice is deemed to have been served on the fifth business day after the day the mail was sent or on the day the notice was received, whichever is earlier.

(3) In this section,

“business day” means Monday to Friday, excluding holidays.
2. Omitted (revokes other Regulations).

content.content:
3. Omitted
(provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).    Français
content.raw_html:
3. Omitted (provides for coming into force of provisions of this Regulation).
